verb.description: Speak and act so as to make it appear that something is the case when in fact it is not.
examples: I closed my eyes and pretended I was asleep
she turned the pages and pretended to read

verb.description: Lay claim to (a quality or title)

adjective.description: Not really what it is represented as being; used in a game or deception.
examples: the children are pouring out pretend tea for the dolls

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin praetendere stretch forth, claim, from prae before + tendere stretch. The adjective dates from the early 20th century.
